job.description:
BrightLink: Software Engineer
BrightLink (
The ideal team member has mastery of computer science and engineering fundamentals and is comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum/Lean development environment. The team member should be passionate about helping others, learning new technologies, leading a team by example, and solving difficult problems.
Who is BrightLink?
Because we build technology for the professional credentialing industry, BrightLink sits in the crossroads between what people were and what they're going to become. We help individuals demonstrate value, articulate trustworthiness, and move to a new chapter of life. Simply put: We help people prove themselves worthy of opportunity.
What are our team’s core values?
Be remarkable
Practice humble service
Nurture enduring partnerships
Always drive to deliver
Seek pragmatic perfection
Create positive personal growth
Engage in camaraderie
Qualifications:
BS in CS/CmpE or a related field
3-5 years experience in professional software development
Significant expertise in the following areas:
Full-stack, web-based application development
Object-oriented programming
Relational databases, including schema design, advanced SQL, and optimization
UNIX-based software development
A strong desire to learn and improve the quality of your craftsmanship
A sense of ownership, urgency, and personal pride in your work
The ability to adapt to changing situations and requirements
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
Confidence in, and passion about, tackling the most challenging of problems
Comfortable investing in junior team members, promoting a healthy development culture, and leading by example
Mastery of any of the following things will be a plus:
Python
PostgreSQL
JavaScript (specifically popular libraries/frameworks such as jQuery, React, Backbone, etc.)
Bootstrap
AWS
Agile/Scrum/Lean development practices
Responsibilities:
Build planned software features, tools, and new products within a Scrum/Lean environment in collaboration with team members and stakeholders
Write high-quality, testable software that is scalable, robust and maintainable
Craft remarkable, high-performance user interfaces
Work together with our Quality Assurance Engineers to identify and fix bugs
Collaborate with other engineers on matters of architecture and solution design
Participate in early-stage product design
Constantly pursue knowledge, and seek to improve your skills and technical professionalism
Share best practices and new technologies with the team and apply them to your work
Benefits:
Paid Vacation and Sick Days
Health and Vision Insurance
401k Plan (with corporate match)
Paid Sabbatical (every 7 years)
Discounted Company Cell Phone Plan
Reading Reward Program
Quarterly Team / Company Activities
Personal or Professional Growth Conference Stipends
Friday Family Lunches for You, Your Spouse and Children
Casual Dress Environment
Paid Recess - Everyday!
Awesome, Collaborative and Open Work Environment
Sure, we look like a technology company. Sharp people working really hard to do something that changes the world in a meaningful way.
However, if you look at our core values you'll notice BrightLink specifically focuses on positive personal growth. Whether it's our team members, clients, or client's clients this means our goal is to leave people better than we found them. You'll be surrounded by people with a drive to grow, discover, and build a better life. If this is something you're interested in, take a look at our currently open positions.
